remarks: Lemma for ~ ulmcau and ~ ulmcau2 : show the equivalence of the four- and five-quantifier forms of the Cauchy convergence condition.  Compare ~ cau3 .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Mar-2015.)
statement:
ulmcau.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
ulmcau.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
ulmcau.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. V ) $.
ulmcau.f $e |- ( ph -> F : Z --> ( CC ^m S ) ) $.
ulmcaulem $p |- ( ph -> ( A. x e. RR+ E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) A. z e. S ( abs ` ( ( ( F ` k ) ` z ) - ( ( F ` j ) ` z ) ) ) < x <-> A. x e. RR+ E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) A. m e. ( ZZ>= ` k ) A. z e. S ( abs ` ( ( ( F ` k ) ` z ) - ( ( F ` m ) ` z ) ) ) < x ) ) $.
$d F j k m x z $.
$d M j k z $.
$d S j k m x z $.
$d Z j k m x z $.
$d j k m ph x z $.
